    Subclasses of GroundFrame in game.body.staticstructs.ground.gothicCemetery
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    final class 
    GothicFlatDefault
    A flat platform using the img GothicFlatDefault.IMG from the GothicvaniaCemetery.
    final class 
    GothicFlatSkull
    A flat platform using the image GothicFlatSkull.IMG with skulls on it.
    final class 
    GothicPillar
    A child of GroundFrame, this class is used to create a pillar in the gothic cemetery.
    class 
    GothicProp
    A class extending Prop, representing various props in the Gothic Cemetery.
    class 
    GothicSlope
    An abstract class used to make slopes which act as a slope for a player to go up and down.
    final class 
    GothicSlopeDefault
    A platform that takes user params and uses its own default image to create a slope.
    final class 
    GothicSlopeSkull
    A GothicSlope using the skull image.
    class 
    GothicSpikes
    Gothic Spikes This class represents a groundFrame object in the game world that deals damage to players and mobs that come into contact with it.

  • Uses of GroundFrame in game.levels

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    GroundFrame
    LevelFrame.add(String name, GroundFrame groundFrame)
    Adds a ground frame to the level.
    If a ground frame with the same name already exists, it will not be added.
    protected GroundFrame
    LevelFrame.get(String name)
    Returns the GroundFrame with the given name.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    GroundFrame
    LevelFrame.add(String name, GroundFrame groundFrame)
    Adds a ground frame to the level.
    If a ground frame with the same name already exists, it will not be added.
    protected void
    LevelFrame.setPos(String identifier, GroundFrame platform)
    Sets the position of a MobWalker with the given identifier to a random place on top of a GroundFrame.
    protected void
    LevelFrame.updatePosition(GroundFrame groundFrame)
    Updates the position of the given ground frame.
    The position is set in relation to the LevelFrame.centre of the level.
